author: bobanahalf
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->
Connecting from linux to Windows to manage services, etc. My connections were working correctly last week.  I've got a list of updates that were applied by my IT guys, but am unsure how to see what's broken.

Note in the example below that SSH connects using a keyfile, but New-PSSession (and Enter-PSSession) fail.  That's why I'm reporting here instead of under OpenSSH.


# Steps to reproduce
I've created a very simple script that reproduces this issue:
```
pwsh

$user_pwsh = 'domain.com\user'; 
$user_ssl = 'user@domain.com'; 
$pass = 'password'; 
$keyfile = '/var/lib/rundeck/.ssh/id_my_rsa'; 
$server = 'server.domain.com'; 

# this connects correctly
ssh -i $keyfile -l $user_ssl $server

# this fails to connect
$session = New-PSsession -HostName $server -UserName $user_pwsh -KeyFilePath $keyfile; 
$session.ComputerName + " ==> " + $session.State
```

# Expected behavior
$session.State ==> Connected (or whatever)

# Actual behavior
$session.State ==> Broken
```
New-PSsession : [maprodevip01v6.vipcustomers.com] The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has ended with error message: key_load_public: invalid format.
At line:1 char:12
+ $session = New-PSsession -HostName $server -UserName $user_pwsh -KeyF ...
+            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Management.A\u2026tion.RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : 2100,PSSessionOpenFailed
```

# Environment data
Client:
```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.1
OS                             Linux 3.10.0-957.10.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Mar 18 15:06:45 UTC 20…
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

Host:
```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: bobanahalf
comments.body:
Nevermind.  Updating SSL trampled all my keys.

The following fixed it for me:
1. Rebuild all my keys with ssh-keygen
2. Republish all my public keys
3. Cleared my known-hosts
4. Reconnected / retrusted all my hosts

title: linux >> windows: manual SSH works, but Enter-PSSession fails
